Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the ninth inning to give the Mets a 4-2 lead.
Jesse Winker scored a run after stealing second base and advancing on a single from Brandon Nimmo.
Starling Marte added another run with a double, bringing Winker home.
Jake Bauers led off the seventh inning with a pinch-hit home run off Mets reliever José Buttó.
Sal Frelick followed with a home run to give Milwaukee a 2-0 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets' bats were quiet until they surged to life in the ninth inning.
Tobias Myers had an outstanding start for Milwaukee, allowing no runs and two hits over five innings.
Jose Quintana pitched nearly as well for the Mets, allowing four hits over six scoreless innings with five strikeouts and one walk.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets advance to the NL division series to face the Philadelphia Phillies.
David Peterson closed out the victory for the Mets, getting Brice Turang to ground into a game-ending double play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pete Alonso's home run was called by Howie Rose on WCBS 880-AM.
The Empire State Building was lit up in blue and orange to celebrate the Mets' playoff series win.
